metatags.author: Steve Alder
metatags.og:title: Pennsylvania’s Updated Breach Notification Law Requires Credit Monitoring Services for Breach Victims
metatags.og:description: Pennsylvania has updated its data breach notification law, narrowing the definition of personal information, adding the requirement to notify the state Pennsylvania has updated its data breach notification law, narrowing the definition of personal information, adding the requirement to notify the state Attorney General, and requiring credit monitoring services to be provided to data breach victims, in certain circumstances.

metatags.og:description:
Breach Based on Harm Threshold: Yes
Deadline for Consumer Notice: Without unreasonable delay
Government Notification Required: Yes
2005 Pa. Laws 474 (unofficially consolidated in 73 P.S. §§ 2301–2329 (West 2019))

metatags.og:title: Pennsylvania Amends Data Breach Reporting Law; Requires Credit Monitoring for Victims
metatags.og:description: On June 28, Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro signed into law Senate Bill (SB) 824, which amended the state’s personal data breach notification statute, commonly known as the Breach of Personal Information Notification Act (PA Notification Act).

metatags.og:title: Pennsylvania Updates Data Breach Notification Law
metatags.og:description: The Governor of Pennsylvania, Tom Wolf, has signed Senate Bill 696 into law, which expands the definition of personal information under the Breach of The Governor of Pennsylvania has signed a new bill that updates the data breach notification law in Pennsylvania which expands the definition of personal information to include healthcare data.
